Marco Marini

Last Updated: January 20, 2018
  • Background
  • IMF Publications
  • Non-IMF Publications
  • All
Expand All
Collapse All

Marco Marini is a Senior Economist of the Strategy, Standards, and Review Division in the IMF Statistics Department (STA). His current activities are providing technical assistance, delivering training courses, and improve the methodology of the quarterly national accounts (QNA). He has worked in the field of national accounts for several national and international agencies since early 2000. He has conducted research and published several papers in the areas of benchmarking, reconciliation, balancing, seasonal adjustment, revisions, and forecasting.

Email: mmarini@imf.org

Education:

2001-2004 Doctorate (PhD) Statistical Methods for Businesses and Economics, University of Rome "RomaTre". 1994-1999 Laurea Economics, Univerisity of Rome "La Sapienza"


Previous Experience:

October 2010 to present: Senior Economist, International Monetary Fund. July 2001 to September 2014: Senior Researcher, ISTAT, National Statistical Institute of Italy. October 2005 to September 2007: Lecturer in Time Series Analysis, University of Naples "Federico II"


Current Position:

Senior Economist, Statistics Department, Strategy, Standards, and Review Division
